attributes.action: Guarantee internet neutrality and support internet user privacy
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The government is planning to introduce legislation which would cut off internet users who 'illegally' download music and films. This is being made under pressure from the music and film industry with claims such as:
- Internet piracy supports organized crime & terrorism 
There is no evidence to suggest that since there is little to no money to be made from internet piracy
- Lies of lost earnings
The figures published are all based on assumptions, there is no independent research, only that of the industry
- Stealing from artists
Musicians make very little money from album sales; they make money from concerts and merchandise. Internet piracy gets artists more exposure and so is more likely to increase artists’ profit.
This law could force ISPs such as BT to spy on users internet activity. This could mean penalties just for watching copyrighted material on sites such as YouTube.
For more about internet piracy watch the documentary "steal this film”
Protect your privacy – demand net neutrality

rejection.details: There is no such proposed legislation.
reasons: Potentially libellous, false, or defamatory statements
